description: Dive into "Majestic Castles of Udaipur Awaits" â€” a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Majestic Castles of Udaipur Awaits

places.generalDescription: The City Palace in Udaipur, Rajasthan is a sprawling complex that houses the palaces of 11 different rulers. It stands tall above Lake Pichola and offers stunning lakeside views. The palace boasts a facade that stretches almost 250 meters in length and rises over 30 meters in height. Visitors can enter through the Baripol Gate or the Tripolia Gate, both dating back to the 17th and 18th centuries.

sources.snippet: Whenever you have your lodging arranged, this is the principal milestone that you should visit. The City Palace, situated on the banks of Lake Pichola, will give you a brief look into Rajasthan's royal glory with its transcending structures worked for the recent Mewar controlling family. The castle will wow voyagers with its flawless insides comprising definite mirror-work, special canvases, paintings, classical furnishings and marble work.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Places to Visit in Udaipur | City of Lakes

sources.snippet: After youâ€™ve settled into your hotel room, the first place you must go to is the City Palace. With its gigantic shrines created for the Mewar royalties, the City Palace, located on the shores of Lake Pichola, will give you an insight into Rajasthanâ€™s imperial luxury. The palaceâ€™s beautiful interiors will wow visitors with meticulous mirror work at the Sheesh Mehal, one-of-a-kind paintings, murals, vintage furniture, and marble work.
sources.shortName: 8 Places Udaipur is Famous for to Visit in Daytime â€“ UdaipurBlog

sources.snippet: Once you have got your hotel room sorted, this is the first landmark that you should visit. The City Palace, located on the banks of Lake Pichola, will give you a glimpse into Rajasthanâ€™s princely grandeur with its towering structures built for the erstwhile Mewar ruling family. The palace will wow travelers with its exquisite interiors consisting detailed mirror-work, unique paintings, murals, antique furniture and marble work.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Places to Visit in Udaipur (2024): Timings, Entry Fee

sources.snippet: The City palace was crafted in 1559, under Maharana Udai Singhâ€™s reign, this majestic beauty looks straight out of fairy tales. Located at the banks of Lake Pichola, the palace boasts of grandeur like no other in Rajasthan â€“ a flamboyant architectural mix of Mughal and Mewar art. A place that leaves you wanting for more, even after the five hours minimal that it will take you to have a â€˜quick tour of the place!
sources.shortName: 30 Best Places to Visit in and Near Udaipur for an unforgettable experience

sources.snippet: The Udaipur City Palace is majestic palace complex that was constructed by successive rulers over the course of centuries. Built with materials ranging from granite, marble, and sandstone, it features numerous elaborate structures that offer insight into Rajasthani culture and history. Visitors can explore this stunning site and admire its intricately designed courtyards, pavilions, gardens, and terraces.
sources.siteName: Todayâ€™s Traveller - Travel & Tourism News, Hotel & Holidays
sources.shortName: 9 captivating Forts and Palaces of Udaipur - Todayâ€™s Traveller

sources.snippet: The City Palace, perched atop a hill overlooking the lake, is a stunning blend of courtyards, pavilions, terraces, corridors, rooms, and hanging gardens. Enclosed by fortified walls, the main entrance is through the triple-arched Tripolia gate, featuring eight marble porticos. The palace is currently home to two luxurious hotels, a school and the popular City Palace Museum.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places & Top Things to Do in 2025

sources.snippet: To say that the City Palace in Udaipur is an absolute marvel, is an understatement. From the time you walk inside, you will be transported to a world of architectural wonder!
sources.shortName: Top 6 Palaces & Forts To Visit In Udaipur| The Leela

places.name: City Palace

reviews.text: Must visit if going to Udaipur, tickeys- 450/person, senior are 350 n students are 200/ person. Water bottle fillining facilites are outside entrance. Its a 3-4 hrs journey entry is from Mardana mahal. Showcasing all artellary of soldier, horse. King descendents. A artist is there to make live sketches. Securiry is good. View from palace is amazing, one side whole city othet side pichola lake. Description is given under every imp things there, Beautiful window gazing, sheesh mahal, painting, wedding hall, Queens palace musical instruments and memorial are well kept .Many places are beautifully restored. Maps of 1600s year and many of India is displayed. Dinning place is made inside. Do take some you water vottle with you and enjoy our culture and ancestory. Not much crowded in weekedays.

A beautiful palace and fort. Well maintained and has amazing glimpses of history.
It is well organised and has all basic facilities.
It has great art works within it and lots of pics spots.
The guides there are well mannered and explain well.
Cameras are allowed and so are phones.
You may have to walk a bit from ticket counter to the main palace, but try doing it, as it has good points on the way.
Takes around 4 hours for a complete visit well but you can spend a complete day in it too and not get bored.
Closed in the night.
Ample parking facility too.

One of the most beautiful palaces in India! The history here is truly remarkable. We booked tickets with a guide, and it made the whole experience really informative. Every section was a delight-the walls, paintings, and artifacts are absolutely stunning.
You can actually see the complete city from this palace!

places.generalDescription: Begin your day in Udaipur with a visit to the majestic City Palace, an iconic landmark that offers breathtaking views of the city. Constructed in 1559 by Maharana Udai Singh II, this sprawling complex has been expanded over the centuries by successive Maharanas, resulting in a stunning array of palaces and mahals. As you explore the palace, you'll be immersed in the grandeur and opulence of Rajasthan's royal history.

sources.snippet: Known as Rajasthanâ€™s largest palace complex, this immemorial architectural beauty was built in an ostentatious style by Maharana Udai Singh II in 1553. This magnificent palace located on Pichola Lake gives a splendid view of the Lake Palace, Jag Mandir, Jagdish Temple, Monsoon Palace and Neemach Mata temple, all of which are just a walk away WIN WIN. You can simply take a bus, taxi or a tonga from the city to reach the palace.
sources.shortName: 8 Best Forts & Palaces In Udaipur - A Handpicked List

sources.snippet: The City Palace of Udaipur stands as a regal testament to the grandeur of the bygone era. Overlooking the vast expanse of Lake Pichola, this palace is a treasure trove of medieval and European artefacts. Its intricate designs narrate tales of the valour and compassion of ancient monarchs.
sources.shortName: Palaces of Udaipur - Treasures of a bygone era

sources.snippet: Offering so many watch-worthy elements, the City Palace must be on your list of must-visit forts in Udaipur. And not to forget, you can visit this fort at a time between 9.30 am and 5.30 pm.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Forts in Udaipur

places.name: City Palace

reviews.text: This beutiful and elegant palace is main attraction of udaypur, Rajasthan. Its huge and royal and surrounded by city lakewhich is so beutiful. Entry free of this palace is 450/ per person but its managable cause you can feel how was the royal life when you enter in this palace. Till now king of udaypur is live on this palace and total property maintain by king. its have lake inside from where anyone can take boat ride of sorrounding and enjoy beutiful sunset on this palace. (750/ per person boat fare).

Must visit if going to Udaipur, tickeys- 450/person, senior are 350 n students are 200/ person. Water bottle fillining facilites are outside entrance. Its a 3-4 hrs journey entry is from Mardana mahal. Showcasing all artellary of soldier, horse. King descendents. A artist is there to make live sketches. Securiry is good. View from palace is amazing, one side whole city othet side pichola lake. Description is given under every imp things there, Beautiful window gazing, sheesh mahal, painting, wedding hall, Queens palace musical instruments and memorial are well kept .Many places are beautifully restored. Maps of 1600s year and many of India is displayed. Dinning place is made inside. Do take some you water vottle with you and enjoy our culture and ancestory. Not much crowded in weekedays.

City Palace in Udaipur is the largest palace in Rajasthan and an absolute must-visit for history lovers and travelers alike. The palace showcases stunning Rajput architecture, with intricate courtyards, balconies, and museums that take you back in time.

I'd recommend visiting in the morning when it's less crowded and you can really soak in the beauty of the place. If you're a student, don't forget to carry your ID card - you'll get your entry ticket at half price, which is a big plus!

Since the palace is massive, whether you take a guide depends on your preference. If you're short on time (around 1 hour), a guide will help you cover the main highlights quickly. But if you enjoy exploring at your own pace, I'd suggest skipping the guide and wandering freely - there's so much to discover.

One important tip: avoid parking your car at the City Palace parking lot. They charge around â‚¹350, which is quite steep. Instead, use the nearby government parking areas around the palace - much more economical.

Overall, City Palace is not just a monument, but an experience of Udaipur's royal heritage. Definitely worth the visit!

places.generalDescription: The Castle Villa in Udaipur is a magnificent escape that embodies luxury and elegance. This stunning villa, with its impressive architecture and beautifully manicured gardens, offers an unforgettable experience for guests. Inside, you'll find spacious rooms adorned with luxurious furnishings and modern amenities that ensure comfort throughout your stay. Perfectly accommodating up to 16 guests in its 5BHK layout, The Castle Villa provides a serene retreat surrounded by breathtaking views.

sources.snippet: Welcome to The Castle Villa Udaipur, renowned as the Best Villa in Udaipur. Our villa is not just a place to stay but a royal retreat where history seamlessly blends with modern luxury. Located in the heart of the City of Lakes, we offer an unparalleled experience that truly makes us the Best Villa in Udaipur.
sources.shortName: Best Villa in Udaipur, Luxury Villa in Udaipur

places.name: The Castle Villa - Luxury Villa in Udaipur

reviews.text:
We enjoyed a perfect staycation at this property..!!! The ambiance was spot-on, creating the ideal atmosphere for relaxation. The swimming pool was fantastic, adding a refreshing touch to our stay, and the bonfire experience in the evenings made it all the more memorable.

The food was excellent, offering a variety of delicious options that kept us more than satisfied. Service was outstanding-fast, friendly, and always eager to help. The caretakers and staff were exceptionally kind, and no request was too much for them. The owner was calm and supportive, ensuring our experience was seamless from start to finish.

This is definitely a property we'll be booking multiple times in the future...!!!

**The Castle Villa: A Majestic Retreat**

The Castle Villa is a splendid getaway that truly lives up to its regal name. Nestled in a picturesque location, this villa offers a blend of elegance and comfort that is hard to match. From the moment you arrive, the grandeur of the villa captivates you with its stunning architecture and beautifully landscaped grounds.

The interiors are equally impressive, featuring spacious rooms with luxurious furnishings and modern amenities. The attention to detail in the decor creates an atmosphere of sophistication and relaxation. The living areas are perfect for unwinding, while the well-equipped kitchen allows for effortless meal preparation.

One of the villa's standout features is the outdoor space. The expansive terrace and private pool offer breathtaking views and a serene environment, making it an ideal spot for both entertaining guests and enjoying quiet moments.

The service is exceptional, with attentive staff who are dedicated to ensuring your stay is as enjoyable as possible. Whether it's arranging activities or providing local recommendations, they go above and beyond.

In summary, The Castle Villa is a remarkable choice for anyone seeking a luxurious and tranquil retreat. Its combination of grandeur, comfort, and top-notch service ensures a memorable stay.

---

Feel free to adjust the review based on specific experiences or details you want to highlight!

Good property, very friendly staff. Plus it is pet friendly, consists of vast garden and swimming pool. The chef cooks very delicious food. (Felt watery mouth recalling the food we enjoyed)

If you are planning to chill & relax with family/friends go for sure. If your purpose is to explore city then would recommend opting for a hotel as this property is in outside and approx 12kms away from city.

Badi lake (Bahubali hill) is 4 kms away, Lake Pichola and Sajjangarh palace are near compared to City palace.

Food 5* | Service 5* | Cleanliness 5* | Cozy 4.5*

places.address: S Babel, Hathi Dhara, Dr. C, near Vishvakarma Temple, Badi, Udaipur, Liyo Ka Gurha, Rajasthan 313001, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled along the serene banks of Lake Pichola, the City Palace in Udaipur stands as a magnificent testament to architectural brilliance. This stunning complex, constructed from exquisite marble and granite, showcases an enchanting blend of European, Medieval, and Chinese design elements. Commissioned by Maharana Udai Singh, it took over 300 years to fully realize this royal residence's grandeur.

sources.snippet: A majestic architectural marvel towering over the lake on a hill surrounded by crenelated walls, it is a conglomeration of courtyards, pavilions, terraces, corridors, rooms and hanging gardens. The main entrance is through the triple arched gate, the "Tripolia" with eight marble porticos, The Maharanas were weighed under the gate in gold, the equivalent amount of which was distributed among the populace. The surajgokhada, the balcony of the sun, is where the SuryanshiMaharanas of Mewar presented themselves to the people in the time of trouble to restore their confidence.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Udaipur, Tourist Places, Points of Interest

sources.snippet: The City Palace is situated on the eastern ribbon of Lake Pichola. This architectural brilliance is a blend of Mughal and Rajasthani architecture and within the grounds of this palace complex there are several palaces. Everyone can walk through the museums, the yards, and the balconies which are opened for the visitors, and those, tired of walking, can sit down on the benches and enjoy the magnificent views on the city and the lake.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Tourist Places in Udaipur

sources.snippet: From the historic City Palace to the tranquil Lake Pichola, guests can explore the rich cultural heritage of Udaipur without straying far from the comfort of their luxurious accommodations.
sources.shortName: Best Villa in Udaipur, Luxury Villa in Udaipur

places.name: City palace
places.address: HPP6+5XH, Ayad, Shakti Nagar, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313002, India

places.generalDescription: Sajjangarh Monsoon Palace, also known as Monsoon Mahal, is a stunning white marble palace perched on a high hill in Udaipur. Built by Maharana Sajjan Singh of the Mewar Dynasty, this palace offers breathtaking panoramic views of Fatehsagar Lake and the surrounding countryside.

sources.snippet: Sajjangarh Palace or The Monsoon Palace is positioned on a hilltop and offers amazing views of Fateh Sagar Lake and the surrounding Sajjangarh Wildlife Sanctuary. This castle-like building is straight out of a fairy tale and is a perfect example of the opulence of the Rajput rulers â€“ the palace was made just to be able to enjoy watching monsoon clouds gather promisingly in the sky!. Built by Maharana Sajjan Singh in 1884, the Sajjangarh Palace should be on your list of places to visit in Udaipur mainly for the spectacular panoramic views of Udaipur city and its stunning lakes, mountains and palaces.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Places to Visit in Udaipur (2024): Timings, Entry Fee

sources.snippet: The Sajjangarh Palace also known as the Monsoon Palace is located on a pinnacle with spectacular views of Fateh Sagar Lake and the Sajjangarh Wildlife Sanctuary. This castle-like structure is straight out of a fairy tale and is a superb example of Rajput majesty â€“ the palace was built solely to enjoy watching clouds that gather in the sky during the monsoon season!. The Sajjangarh Palace, built by Maharana Sajjan Singh in 1884, should be on your list of sites to see in Udaipur, mostly for the phenomenal panoramic view of the city and its beautiful lakes, mountains, and castles.
sources.shortName: 8 Places Udaipur is Famous for to Visit in Daytime â€“ UdaipurBlog

sources.snippet: Also known as Monsoon Palace, Sajjangarh Palace is located at a peak Bansdara Mountain as high as about 944 m above the sea level overlooking the famous Pichola Lake. This palace is also known Monsoon Palace because it was used as summer retreat for Mewar Kings and also as a Monsoon Palace, to watch the progress of Monsoon clouds. Timings: 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM (all days of the week)Entry Fee: INR 100 (Indians) and INR 335 (Foreigners), INR 100 (Vehicle Entry)Location: 11 Monsoon Colony, Sajjan Garh Road, Udaipur.
sources.shortName: 8 Beautiful Palaces in Udaipur to Visit (2024)

sources.snippet: Nestled atop the Aravalli hills, the Sajjangarh Palace majestically overlooks the shimmering waters of Lake Fateh Sagar and Udaipurâ€™s iconic City Palace. Its grandeur, discernible even from the cityâ€™s heart, paints a captivating silhouette against the sky, making it a haven for photography enthusiasts. The palaceâ€™s allure was further magnified when it became a filming location for the 1983 James Bond film, â€œOctopussy.
sources.shortName: Palaces of Udaipur - Treasures of a bygone era

sources.snippet: Formerly known as the Sajjangarh Palace, the Monsoon Palace is a hilltop residence that offers a spectacular view of palaces, lakes and the surrounding countryside. As the name suggests, this palace was built to watch the progress of the monsoon clouds. Located in the Aravalli Hills, the palace glows with a golden orange colour in the evening and proves to a perfect sunset gazing spot.
sources.shortName: 8 Best Forts & Palaces In Udaipur - A Handpicked List

sources.snippet: As you make your way up to the Monsoon Palace, surrounded by rugged hills and lush vegetation, you will feel the anticipation rising. When you crest the last hill and finally see this breathtaking palace, standing tall, it will leave you wanting more.
sources.shortName: Top 6 Palaces & Forts To Visit In Udaipur| The Leela

sources.snippet: You might have seen this palace in James Bondâ€™s famous film, Octopussy. If not, book one of the flights to Udaipur and come to see its beauty with your naked eyes. Nothing matches a first-hand experience, after all!.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Forts in Udaipur

sources.siteName: Todayâ€™s Traveller - Travel & Tourism News, Hotel & Holidays
sources.shortName: 9 captivating Forts and Palaces of Udaipur - Todayâ€™s Traveller

places.name: Monsoon Palace

reviews.text:
The calm and view of sunset just touched my soul. This palace in udaipur truly made my day. I am silhouette lover and sunset is the soul for a silhouette. This palace is totally made for the sunset view. I visited here in march end week and I missed the sunset view from the karni mata mandir. But caught the full ðŸŒ‡ sunset view at this palace.

The price can be feel bit high but truly worth it. Here, you can go by your own vehicle or by buying ticket for car service that will provide take and drop service.

Note: If you took their vehicle service don't lost the ticket as the contact details are written on the ticket only. So , if you missed the last car while enjoying till bit late. So you can contact them and they will come to pick you. But try to come back till 6pm last after that you will not get auto or any online service as this place is far from local areas.

The Monsoon Palace is less about grandeur and more about atmospheric beauty-a place where history, nature, and romance come together under dramatic skies. While the structure itself is modest, the views are unforgettable-especially during sunset or after the monsoon rains. It's a must-visit for anyone seeking a tranquil, picture-perfect escape with a touch of royal nostalgia.

Beautiful Location, Especially During Monsoon But a Bit Overpriced..

Monsoon Palace is located on a hill surrounded by lush greenery, offering breathtaking views especially during the monsoon season, when its natural beauty multiplies. The road leading to the top is about 4 km long, steep, and winding, making it more suitable for experienced drivers.
Auto-rickshaws are not allowed, so visitors must either use their own vehicle or a government-approved cab. At the top, there's a small restaurant where you can enjoy coffee and snacks amidst scenic views and cool, refreshing winds.
From the palace, you get a panoramic view of Udaipur city, which is truly mesmerizing and peaceful. The palace also features a small wildlife exhibit and an interactive projector where you can see yourself amidst wild animals-a fun experience, though nothing extraordinary.
You should plan to spend at least an hour exploring the place. However, I felt the entry ticket (â‚¹174 per person) is a bit overpriced for what's offered. Also, personal car parking costs â‚¹338, which is quite expensive and should be reviewed by the authorities.

Overall, the place is worth visiting for nature lovers and photographers, especially during the rainy season but be prepared for the high charges.
